    • Constructor Detail

      • KernelSupportVectorMachine

        public KernelSupportVectorMachine(IKernel kernel,
                                  int inputs)
        Creates a new Kernel Support Vector Machine. If the number of inputs is zero, this means the machine accepts a indefinite number of inputs. This is often the case for kernel vector machines using a sequence kernel.
        Parameters:
        kernel - The chosen kernel for the machine.
        inputs - The number of inputs for the machine.

    • Method Detail

      • getKernel

        public IKernel getKernel()
        Gets the kernel used by this machine.
        Returns:
        Kernel.

      • setKernel

        public void setKernel(IKernel value)
        Sets the kernel used by this machine.
        Parameters:
        value - Kernel.

      • Compute

        public double Compute(double[] inputs)
        Computes the given input to produce the corresponding output. For a binary decision problem, the decision for the negative or positive class is typically computed by taking the sign of the machine's output.
        Overrides:
        Compute in class SupportVectorMachine
        Parameters:
        inputs - An input vector.
        Returns:
        The decision label for the given input.
